page.title: 01ROCKY OUTCROPS E OF WHITWICK
page.content: Charnwood forest containes exposures of some of th oldest rocks found in Lowland England. Dating from pre-Cambrian times, about 570 million years ago, the igneous rock outcrops in the core of the Charnwood area resulted from intense volcanic activity probably centred on the Whitwick area. Many of these outcrops are quarried today for roadstone in the S.W. of this block. Many attractive buildings in the area make use of the local granite. Quarrying is the main industry in the region. The area as a whole is used mostly for pasture and cereal crops with some managed woodland. There are many scenic spots easily accessible by some good footpaths.
